event: Wolfe steps down as UM System President
Maneater publishes an editorial standing with the members of #StillConcerned
J-School professors publish open letter denouncing his blocking of students on Twitter
Choi unblocks students on Twitter following the threat of a lawsuit
First student protests take place at an event called "Racism Lives Here"
Students block Wolfe's car during the homecoming parade
MSA President Payton Head posted on Facebook about his experiences with racism on campus
Jonathan Butler wrote an open letter to Chancellor Loftin in response to Loftin's diversity training plan.
Concerned Student 1950 (CS 1950) issues a list of demands to MU, among them is a demand for Wolfe's resignation
CS 1950 meets with Wolfe, who refuses to meet their demands
Johnathan Butler begins a hunger strike in responses to Wolfe dismissing the Black students' concerns.
Black football players announce they would not participate in any football related activities until Wolfe resigned.
#StillConcerned begins posting a list of demands on Twitter, some parallel to the demands from 2015. New to the list is a call for the removal of the Thomas Jefferson statue on the Francis Quadrangle
Choi blocks students who are publicly criticizing his administration from his Twitter
The Mizzou Black Student Athlete Association organizes a march protesting politce brutality against the Black community.
